intro: Julocroton microcalyx, commonly known as the small-leaved croton, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of yellowish-green cyathia, which are specialized inflorescences typical of the family. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
